cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles SW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northeast toward the Florida Panhandle, then expected to turn ENE and cross the southeastern United States before moving off the North Carolina coast and into the western Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect from Navarre FL to Yankeetown FL (north of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning from Indian Pass FL to Clearwater Beach FL (includes Tampa Bay and Manatee County Port area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Gulf Coast of Florida, including Tampa Bay, from Indian Pass through Clearwater Beach
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible early Saturday as outer bands pass.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 1–3 ft possible in Tampa Bay, including berths at Manatee County Port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rainfall Saturday with locally higher pockets; could cause minor ponding but widespread flooding not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk in outer rain bands through Saturday morning.
